Declaration public int Baseline { get; } Property Value Type Description int Remarks Must be less than or equal to Height. | Improve this Doc View Source Direction The direction that text reads when rendered with this font. RightToLeft Text flows from the right to the left.

api/Figletize.Utilities.StringPool.html.keywords: Class StringPool An object pool for merging references to identical strings. Inheritance object StringPool Namespace: Figletize.Utilities Assembly: Figletize.dll Syntax public sealed class StringPool Remarks Unlike string interning the pool may be released and garbage collected. Methods | Improve this Doc View Source Pool(string) Returns a reference to a string equal to s from the pool. If no such string exists within the pool, it is added, and s is returned. Declaration public string Pool(string s) Parameters Type Name Description string s The string to pool. Returns Type Description string A reference to the pooled string.

index.html.title: What is Figletize? | Figletize API - Aptivi Internals
index.html.keywords: What is Figletize? Figletize is a library that allows you to generate Figlet text. What is this web page? This webpage is an API documentation for mod developers to be used as reference. It constantly gets updated as we push the updates to the main and servicing versions of this project. If you still intend to use a documentation specific to your preferred version of Figletize, you may refer to the releases page of the project and download the attached <version>-doc.rar file. To get started using the documentation, select API Documentation from the top menu and select a namespace to get a clear overview of the API. Feedback If you wish to leave feedback to us about this API reference website, use the issue tracker of the project. If you wish to contribute to the documentation of the API, go to the project source code and make your improvements there on a draft Pull Request; we don't support override files that are made by clicking on Improve this doc. Any meaningful contributions are welcome. Copyright (c) 2017-2023 Drew Noakes. All rights reserved. Copyright (c) 2023-2024 - Aptivi. All rights reserved.
